snippet: A new Unicef report says that about 800,000 children have been forced from their homes in northeast Nigeria by the Boko Haram uprising, with many separated from their families and some subjected to abuse and forced marriage.
abstract: Unicef reports the number of children displaced in northeast Nigeria by Boko Haram militants has doubled from the past year to 800,000 and comprises half of the 1.5 million made homeless by the war.
lead_paragraph: A new Unicef report says that about 800,000 children have been forced from their homes in northeast Nigeria by the Boko Haram uprising, with many separated from their families and some subjected to abuse and forced marriage.
